external.description:
Alt: I sometimes think I love PowerShell because it's kind of like an independent privateer between operating systems and ecosystems.

Other days I just love that it lets me code like a pirate:  it makes dirty tricks like this so easy, and feels so wrong it's right.
external.title: a close up of a man wearing a pirate hat and a ring on his finger

record.text:
You have two choices:

1. Talk to Windows APIs with a bit of P/Invoke to activate the window handle.

2. Give your powershell window a title, and then use:

$wsh = New-Object -Com WScript.Shell
$wsh.AppActivate($title)

Dirty tricks, like Goonies or Captain Jack Sparrow, never die. üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è üòâüòé

Enjoy!
